attr.name: getMongo
attr.description: Returns the current database connection

attr.name: getName
attr.description: Returns the name of the DB

attr.name: getCollectionNames
attr.description: Returns an array containing the names of all collections in the current database.

attr.name: getCollectionInfos
attr.description: Returns an array of documents with collection information, i.e. collection name and options, for the current database.

attr.name: runCommand
attr.description: Runs an arbitrary command on the database.

attr.name: adminCommand
attr.description: Runs an arbitrary command against the admin database.

attr.name: aggregate
attr.description: Runs a specified admin/diagnostic pipeline which does not require an underlying collection.

attr.name: getSiblingDB
attr.description: Returns another database without modifying the db variable in the shell environment.

attr.name: getCollection
attr.description: Returns a collection or a view object that is functionally equivalent to using the db.<collectionName>.

attr.name: dropDatabase
attr.description: Removes the current database, deleting the associated data files.

attr.name: createUser
attr.description: Creates a new user for the database on which the method is run. db.createUser() returns a duplicate user error if the user already exists on the database.

attr.name: updateUser
attr.description: Updates the user’s profile on the database on which you run the method. An update to a field completely replaces the previous field’s values. This includes updates to the user’s roles array.

attr.name: changeUserPassword
attr.description: Updates a user’s password. Run the method in the database where the user is defined, i.e. the database you created the user.

attr.name: logout
attr.description: Ends the current authentication session. This function has no effect if the current session is not authenticated.

attr.name: dropUser
attr.description: Removes the user from the current database.

attr.name: dropAllUsers
attr.description: Removes all users from the current database.

attr.name: auth
attr.description: Allows a user to authenticate to the database from within the shell.

attr.name: grantRolesToUser
attr.description: Grants additional roles to a user.

attr.name: revokeRolesFromUser
attr.description: Removes a one or more roles from a user on the current database.

attr.name: getUser
attr.description: Returns user information for a specified user. Run this method on the user’s database. The user must exist on the database on which the method runs.

attr.name: getUsers
attr.description: Returns information for all the users in the database.

attr.name: createCollection
attr.description: Create new collection

attr.name: createEncryptedCollection
attr.description: Creates a new collection with a list of encrypted fields each with unique and auto-created data encryption keys (DEKs). This is a utility function that internally utilises ClientEnryption.createEncryptedCollection.

attr.name: createView
attr.description: Create new view

attr.name: createRole
attr.description: Creates a new role.

attr.name: updateRole
attr.description: Updates the role’s profile on the database on which you run the method. An update to a field completely replaces the previous field’s values.

attr.name: dropRole
attr.description: Removes the role from the current database.

attr.name: dropAllRoles
attr.description: Removes all roles from the current database.

attr.name: grantRolesToRole
attr.description: Grants additional roles to a role.

attr.name: revokeRolesFromRole
attr.description: Removes a one or more roles from a role on the current database.

attr.name: grantPrivilegesToRole
attr.description: Grants additional privileges to a role.

attr.name: revokePrivilegesFromRole
attr.description: Removes a one or more privileges from a role on the current database.

attr.name: getRole
attr.description: Returns role information for a specified role. Run this method on the role’s database. The role must exist on the database on which the method runs.

attr.name: getRoles
attr.description: Returns information for all the roles in the database.

attr.name: currentOp
attr.description: Runs an aggregation using $currentOp operator. Returns a document that contains information on in-progress operations for the database instance. For further information, see $currentOp.

attr.name: killOp
attr.description: Calls the killOp command. Terminates an operation as specified by the operation ID. To find operations and their corresponding IDs, see $currentOp or db.currentOp().

attr.name: shutdownServer
attr.description: Calls the shutdown command. Shuts down the current mongod or mongos process cleanly and safely. You must issue the db.shutdownServer() operation against the admin database.

attr.name: fsyncLock
attr.description: Calls the fsync command. Forces the mongod to flush all pending write operations to disk and locks the entire mongod instance to prevent additional writes until the user releases the lock with a corresponding db.fsyncUnlock() command.

attr.name: fsyncUnlock
attr.description: Calls the fsyncUnlock command. Reduces the lock taken by db.fsyncLock() on a mongod instance by 1.

attr.name: version
attr.description: returns the db version. uses the buildinfo command

attr.name: serverBits
attr.description: returns the db serverBits. uses the buildInfo command

attr.name: isMaster
attr.description: Calls the isMaster command

attr.name: hello
attr.description: Calls the hello command

attr.name: serverBuildInfo
attr.description: returns the db serverBuildInfo. uses the buildInfo command

attr.name: serverStatus
attr.description: returns the server stats. uses the serverStatus command

attr.name: stats
attr.description: returns the db stats. uses the dbStats command

attr.name: hostInfo
attr.description: Calls the hostInfo command

attr.name: serverCmdLineOpts
attr.description: returns the db serverCmdLineOpts. uses the getCmdLineOpts command

attr.name: rotateCertificates
attr.description: Calls the rotateCertificates command

attr.name: printCollectionStats
attr.description: Prints the collection.stats for each collection in the db.

attr.name: getFreeMonitoringStatus
attr.description: Calls the getFreeMonitoringStatus command

attr.name: disableFreeMonitoring
attr.description: returns the db disableFreeMonitoring. uses the setFreeMonitoring command

attr.name: enableFreeMonitoring
attr.description: returns the db enableFreeMonitoring. uses the setFreeMonitoring command

attr.name: getProfilingStatus
attr.description: returns the db getProfilingStatus. uses the profile command

attr.name: setProfilingLevel
attr.description: returns the db setProfilingLevel. uses the profile command

attr.name: setLogLevel
attr.description: returns the db setLogLevel. uses the setParameter command

attr.name: getLogComponents
attr.description: returns the db getLogComponents. uses the getParameter command

attr.name: cloneDatabase
attr.description: deprecated, non-functional

attr.name: cloneCollection
attr.description: deprecated, non-functional

attr.name: copyDatabase
attr.description: deprecated, non-functional

attr.name: commandHelp
attr.description: returns the db commandHelp. uses the passed in command with help: true

attr.name: listCommands
attr.description: Calls the listCommands command

attr.name: getLastErrorObj
attr.description: Calls the getLastError command

attr.name: getLastError
attr.description: Calls the getLastError command

attr.name: printShardingStatus
attr.description: Calls sh.status(verbose)

attr.name: printSecondaryReplicationInfo
attr.description: Prints secondary replicaset information

attr.name: getReplicationInfo
attr.description: Returns replication information

attr.name: printReplicationInfo
attr.description: Formats sh.getReplicationInfo

attr.name: printSlaveReplicationInfo
attr.description: DEPRECATED. Use db.printSecondaryReplicationInfo

attr.name: setSecondaryOk
attr.description: This method is deprecated. Use db.getMongo().setReadPref() instead

attr.name: watch
attr.description: Opens a change stream cursor on the database

attr.name: sql
attr.description: (Experimental) Runs a SQL query against Atlas Data Lake. Note: this is an experimental feature that may be subject to change in future releases.
